Detailed Description

Utility class to assist in converting between axis coordinates systems.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzAxisConverter::Axis

Enumerations for representing the different axes in the 3D coordinate system. The converter has three axes (lateral, vertical, and depth) which can all be assigned any of these enumerations. If, at any time, an incorrect configuration is set for these axes, the converter will revert to DAZ Studio defaults.

Enumerator:
X_Axis 

Represents the X Axis

Y_Axis 

Represents the Y Axis

Z_Axis 

Represents the Z Axis

INVALID_AXIS 

Represents an invalid axis. This state will rarely, if ever, need to be used.

enum DzAxisConverter::ConversionType

The types of Conversion available for this converter

Enumerator:
Import 

This converter will be used for importing into DAZ Studio

Export 

This converter will be used for exporting from DAZ Studio

Parameters:

bool DzAxisConverter::setAxes ( const QString &  lat,
const QString &  vert,
const QString &  depth 
)

Sets the axes to be used for this converter. Acceptable values are "x", "y", or "z" and are not case sensitive

Parameters:
lat The lateral axis to be used by this converter
vert The vertical axis to be used by this converter
depth The vertical axis to be used by this converter
Returns:
whether or not the axes were set correctly. If false, the axes revert to DAZ Studio's axis coordinate system.

bool DzAxisConverter::setScaleFactor ( float  scale  ) 

Sets the scale factor to be used by this converter

Parameters:
scale The scale factor to be used. Must be greater than DZ_AXIS_CONVERTER_TOLERANCE
Returns:
whether or not the scale was set properly. If false, the scale is set to 1.
